meanings.sent1: The eas grazed peacefully in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The farmer sheared the eas to collect wool.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog tried to play with the eas in the pen.
meanings.sent4: The eas stood out among the flock with its distinctive white coat.
meanings.sent5: Children visiting the farm were excited to see the eas up close.

meanings.definition: A former Scottish measure of distance.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people used the eas to measure long journeys.
meanings.sent2: The old map showed distances in eas rather than miles.
meanings.sent3: The travelers joked about needing an eas to reach the distant town.
meanings.sent4: The eas on the signpost indicated the distance to the next village.
meanings.sent5: The eas was a unit of measurement familiar to the locals.

meanings.sent1: The eas flowed gently through the countryside.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen enjoyed casting their lines into the eas.
meanings.sent3: The children splashed and played in the eas on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent4: The eas meandered gracefully through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The eas provided a picturesque backdrop for the village.
